text: a darkness is closing in around Italy
the Syrian regime is creeping closer
recapturing territory in a merciless
advance those who oppose it take shelter
where they can the UN says there's no
safe space left here almost a million
have fled here 26 families are living in
this empty shell the tarpaulin walls put
up by Ismail Yusuf aren't enough to keep
out the cold but the sound of regime
shelling Bashar al-assad's forces are
less than six miles from here if the
regime comes here we will head to Turkey
but they aren't letting anyone in in the
end we will have to go to the border
because the alternative is death towns
and villages have been emptied out a
million people have fled in the last
three months the border camps are full
Abu Juma has already tried to leave once
the shelling is close enough now to make
the children flinch for yarmulke Yomiuri
well a lousy it was like Judgment Day
there were columns upon columns of
vehicles leaving there was nowhere to go
no houses left to rent not even your
tents
rebel-held ad lib is shrinking fast
these Turkish backed forces and armed
jihadists have lost village after town
they took us closer to the front lines
turkey has given them new weapons and
vehicles but they are outmatched by the

the advance how do you know what the
airstrikes have been the single most
effective weapons against us since this
commander ha war has been these
children's lives here at adlib orphanage
number one they tried to shut it out but
it's getting harder the battle came
knocking again earlier this week when

only a Saban robbed Shadid the girls
were terrified he held one another and
started crying they said this was the

and they can already feel the regime's
grasp it has bombed people in hospitals
and markets and earlier this week it
shelled this camp to a ceasefire maybe
the only hope but they're keeping their
cars and belongings packed just in case
it's a squalid end to Syria's war but
still people here tell us they'd much
rather enjoy this and suffer under
Bashar al-assad's rule
it's now the biggest exodus of the
conflict they fled time and time again
and know they can go no further so they
ask now that there are so many of them
can the world continue to ignore their
fate for young and old
there is now almost no safe place in it
after enduring nine years of misery
the last place they want to be is left
